intro: Omphalea glandulata, commonly known as the glandular sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
